About me

  • I was born in Mississippi, spent the next years of my life in Louisiana, and now have moved to Texas; I guess you could say I am a proud Southern lady.
  • The things I love most are my children (including my daughter-in- law), going to church, Southern traditions, country music, walking along a beach, reading, and yes……mathematics.
  • My educational philosophy is that as teachers we are to give students the tools they need to be successful in the next step of their life.
  • I believe the most important aspect of any student’s education is the cooperation of administrators, teachers, parents, and students.

Experience

  • Graduated from Louisiana Tech University in 1981 with a B.S. in Mathematics Education and a minor in English Education
  • Received a Masters from Louisiana Tech University in 1986
  • Continued my education for my +30 graduate hours
  • My teaching experience includes General Math, Algebra 1, Algebra 2, Geometry, College Algebra, College Precalculus, Calculus AB, Calculus BC, Math Essentials, 8 th grade Mathematics, College Trigonometry, and Applied Calculus
  • Currently teaching Algebra 1
